replay,4,buckj001,TOR,wintm901,TOR02,O,N,I,,H $John Buck's fly hit the top of the wall in CF; the Blue Jays thought it hit over the fence and came back onto the field; acting crew chief Mike Winters watched the replay and upheld the call
$off Aaron Hill's glove into short CF
$Jose Bautista was hit by the throw and was called for interference
$the Rays lose the use of a DH

ej,maddj801,M,herna901,Not allowing Carlos Pena time out $Carlos Pena asked HP umpire Angel Hernandez for time as Blue Jays pitcher Kevin Gregg started his motion; Hernandez did not grant time and then called Gregg's pitch strike three; Pena objected and started arguing with Hernandez; Rays manager Joe Maddon came out to get between the two and was ejected by Hernandez; Maddon continued to yell, then went to 3B to yell at crew chief Joe West, then returned to Hernandez before leaving the field

ej,gregk001,P,herna901,Balls and strikes $as Blue Jays pitcher Kevin Gregg left the field after being replaced, he said something to HP umpire Angel Hernandez, who told Gregg to leave; Gregg made some motions as he continued to argue about the strike zone and was ejected by Hernandez; Gregg had to be restrained by coach Nick Leyva
$Sean Rodriguez scored from second on Ben Zobrist's single but the Blue Jays appealed and Rodriguez was called out for missing the bag at third

$Robinson Cano's grounder was just inside the 3B bag and curved into foul territory where it was cleanly fielded by the ball boy; 3B umpire Gary Darling signalled fan interference and awarded Cano second

$3B umpire Gary Darling walked down to the ball boy and said something to him and took his glove away from him; Darling gave it to one of the police officers standing on the field during the break, who eventually returned it to the owner; later (also between innings), the Blue Jays mascot put caution tape around the ball boy
$Yankees Nick swisher argued the called third strike with HP umpire Bruce Dreckman
$Yankees Alex Rodriguez argued the called third strike with HP umpire Bruce Dreckman

ej,giraj001,M,drecb901,Balls and strikes $HP umpire Bruce Dreckman called the check swing for strike three on Nick Swisher, who argued with Dreckman; Yankees manager Joe Girardi ran out without his hat, pushed Swisher away and was quickly ejected by Dreckman; Girardi then tried to wipe out the chalk line on the batter's box and said a few more things to Dreckman before leaving

$Yankees acting manager Tony Pena called for a left-hander out of the bullpen but Mariano Rivera came into the mound; Pena and the umpires talked and Rivera was sent back to the bullpen and Marte came into the game

$this game was scheduled to be played in Toronto; due to an economic summit meeting of world leaders held in that city, the series was moved to Philadelphia; the Blue Jays batted last and wore their home uniforms

ej,jansc001,P,carlm901,Runner placement on fan interference $Bill Hall's hit down the RF line was touched by a fan and ruled interference; Mike Cameron had stopped at 3B but was sent home by 3B umpire Mark Carlson; pitcher Casey Janssen argued about the call and was ejected by Carlson; the umpires then huddled and put Cameron back on 3B

ej,camem001,P,kellj901,Called third strike ej,frant001,M,kellj901,Mike Cameron ejection; 'ejected' umpire $Mike Cameron was not happy with the called third strike; after he got back into the dugout, he was ejected by HP umpire Jeff Kellogg; Cameron started out of the dugout but was stopped by manager Terry Francona, who went to the plate to argue with Kellogg; he was quickly ejected by Kellogg and then Francona made similar motion as if to eject Kellogg

$there were problems with the retractable roof; one panel remained in place, leaving shadows over the infield; both home plate and the mound were in the shade for the first three innings; the mound was in the sun by the fourth, creating a very difficult contrast for hitters

ej,escoy001,P,mealj901,Balls and strikes ej,gastc101,M,mealj901,Ejection of Escobar $as Blue Jays shortstop Yunel Escobar walked to his position, he exchanged words with HP umpire Jerry Meals and was ejected by Meals; Blue Jays Manager Cito Gaston ran onto the field too late to save Escobar and then argued with Meals for a while before begin ejected as well

$the second pitch to Jose Bautista was up and went to the backstop; Bautista yelled at Yankees pitcher Ivan Nova, who yelled back; HP umpire Jerry Meals warned both teams; as the two players kept talking, Yankees catcher Francisco Cervelli and manager Joe Girardi held Bautista back; both benches cleared but players just stood around
